Life Time Accessibility

Advocacy, Design, Development, Education, Documentation

Summary

  • …
  • …

Background

Over the years as a designer and front-end developer I’ve been aware that there’s a balance between expression and boundaries, between creativity and code. Limitations become the channels for artistry. A lake is can be stagnant, but bring the banks closer and now you have movement—a river.

In late 2008, when WCAG 2.0 was published, the groundwork was being laid in the industry for something that could been seen as restricting or a legitimate catalyst ensuring that the work being done could reach an audience without barriers. I chose the latter.

Objective

Life Time serves members in many ways. From its clubs to coworking, and events to programs it is a public place of accommodation. But more than that, it‘s a company that has literally created the healthy way of life category. The implications are limitless, and because of that the ability to use our digital properties should be too.
